title: Introduction
description: JavaScript is a programming language used to make web pages interactive. It runs in the browser and allows you to respond to user actions.
lessonExample:
// This code runs in the browser
console.log("Welcome to JavaScript!")
hints: Your code should run without errors.

title: Console Output
description: Display messages in the browser's console using console.log().
hints: Put your message inside the parentheses.
Remember to wrap text in quotes.

title: Variables
description: Variables store information that can be used later. Use let or const to create variables.
hints: Use let or const to create a variable.

title: Data Types
description: JavaScript supports different data types such as strings, numbers, and booleans.
